lead_paragraph: Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas called for an end to the resettlement of refugees from countries overrun by terrorist groups after the arrests.

byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Houston and Liam Stack from New York.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and LIAM STACK

headline.print_headline: 2 Iraqi Refugees in Texas and California Are Charged With Ties to Terror Groups
headline.main: Iraqi Refugees in Texas and California Accused of Terrorism Ties

snippet: Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas called for an end to the resettlement of refugees from countries overrun by terrorist groups after the arrests.
abstract: Law enforcement officials say Omar Faraj Saeed Al Hardan and Aws Mohammed Younis Al-Jayab, Iraqi-born Palestinian refugees resettled in Texas and California, respectively, have been arrested on terrorism-related charges; men are accused of having ties to jihadist terrorist groups in Iraq and Syria, including Islamic State.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
